page.title: 08HOUSING PROBLEMS IN KIRKBY
page.content: As relatively few houses have been built recently,property is in heavy demand,especially as the{Lake District is so close.Many elderly people chose to{retire}in the district which gives an imbalance in the population.The result is that house prices are high but less than in the Lake District. Most property is{owner-occupied,}but some is available for renting.As the number of aged has increased the amount of sheltered accommodation has developed.There is a demand for {tourist-orientated}businesses but few come on the market.In recent years there has been an increase in the number of{holiday cottages,}either occupied by one family or let as a business proposition.These factors make it difficult for young{married {couples}to find suitable accommodation and so tend to move away.
